etymons.meaning: to bear, carry; to become pregnant; < MEA ṭʕn (Af.) cf. SL 544: to place a load upon; to order to carry

Preterit.turoyo: 4) səmleaʕmabə-gnowo (непонимаюслово), hiya barṯo, ṭʕino b-u=bayto 266; prs 1/3; prs 46/5; prs 68/8, 12; 60/53, 130;

Infectum.turoyo: 3) i=čanṭayḏisimo m-galdo. kət-la dastike. b-i=dastik-aṯe k-məṭʕono 265; 9/29-30; hwawuamīn, u=yawmo d-əzzoxu l-Məḏyaḏʕalak=katfoṯogəm-məṭʕonutu! ḏḏ’; 11/326; 4) k-mičoki an=nišeayna d-lo=k-məṭʕonotaḥt u=šoriṭo 266; prs 153/31; 60/130;kītgabesəsyekḥelgudəzzuxmḥalqətruḥuxgabe k-owe d-obe-lux səsyo me-diḏeoṯe l-u=səst-ayḏux w-məṭʕono
translations: ‘He has horses of distinguished breed. If you go and turn to him, perhaps he will give you a stallion. He (the stallion, m.) will approach your mare, and she will become pregnant’ 82/8;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: 1) u=waziromoyád-way-le ṭoʕán-way-le masláq-way-le l-malʕal 265; 60/83; u=aščiyayḏi i=naqqa d-əzze-wo l-u=šuqo l-i=šqolo d-medeŭbé-wo-le sartulonaʕimo b-feme; w Lili, ṭŭʕán-wo-le b-ʕašq1/54;
translations: Koch auf den Markt ging, um
Korb ins Maul, und Lily trug

Imperativ.turoyo: 1) ṭʕan-le l-Xāngīr w mbal-le gab ann=aḥunoneChāngîr 265; 73/455; mawfaqleere d-u=səsyo, omərṭʕan-e, šiḏo 265; prs 234/15;

Preterit.turoyo: mawfaqleak=kallat w ad=dərrayat w u=māl d-kət-wo tamo, w nafəqmaṭʕalle ab=baġle 266; prs 24/3, 22; prs 98/21; húle-le-steḥsar=ǧuweri l-i=barṯoaʕma, maṭʕálle-la dahwo, semo, kallātġálabe ‘’; 24/134;u=ḥayawmomaṭʕanneʕaṣroḥamšaḥsar=zlamat a=ḥmor-aṯṯeabšoṯe w-azzehən d-mublən-ne l-Gziro, l-u=ʕmiro d-Gziro
translations: ‘One day 10-15 men loaded their donkeys with raisins to bring them to the emir of Jazira’; 38/5

Preterit.turoyo: 2)Lu Sargeymaṭʕanle u baytayḏe = Sargey moved to a different house (İlyas p.c)

Infectum.turoyo: k-qoyəm u=karwan-anog-maṭʕən, w g-əzzehən, gə-mhalxi b-u=darbo, ʕaṣroḥamšaḥṣar=yawme, g-moṭən l-dukṯoqṭəʕto m-am=maye 266; 77/96; u=yawm-awo d-kət-yomʕayno d-u=ʕeḏ-ayḏe, k-maṭʕənkulmede d-kət-le māl, zangane, ṯarwe <...> kule k-maṭʕal-le k-mŭbe-le l-larwal m-i=walayeʻʼ; 24/294; g-maṭəʕnat u=ṭaʕn-ayḏux w-g-əzzúx b-u=darbo
translations: ‘You will load your load and take the road’; 46/14
‘We went to Adana and picked up the cargo from there’ EL 25;

Imperativ.turoyo: aṭʕal-li u=ḥamro, d-uzzímzabán-nux-yo b-i=walaye 266; prs 244/24; maṭʕan u=mede d-k-əbʕət mal
translations: mir den Wein auf, ich will
‘Load (yourself) with any goods that you want’ MM 152;

Part. Pass..turoyo: mḥayḏ̣álle-learbʕi=gamlemáṭʕəne 267; 24/133; arbaḥṣar=ṭonatkət-wamaṭaʕnoʕal u=tankerayḏi EL 36; gd-oṯən-waak=kalake me Dyārbăkər, me lalʕal, w maṭaʕnemālRT 9;
